exceptions.tactic: rewrite <- Hc with (f := linker) (n := 1) (x := (i, lsum (snd P) + i)).
exceptions.exn: In environment X, Y : Type c : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y lc : X -> nat Hc : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (c f n x) = lc x P : nat * list X i, err : nat The term "(i, lsum (snd P) + i)" has type "(nat * nat)%type" while it is expected to have type "X".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

X: Type
c: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
lc: X -> nat

P: (nat * list X)%type
err: nat
i: nat

Goal:
linker (code_start P) = i

link = fix link (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat) {struct ll} : list (nat * nat) := match ll with | nil => nil | x :: ll0 => (i, j) :: link (S i) ll0 (lc x + j) end : nat -> list X -> nat -> list (nat * nat) Arguments link _%nat_scope _%list_scope _%nat_scope
comp = fun lnk : nat -> nat => fix comp (i : nat) (ll : list X) (j : nat) {struct ll} : list Y := match ll with | nil => nil | x :: ll0 => c lnk i x ++ comp (S i) ll0 (lc x + j) end : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> list X -> nat -> list Y Arguments comp _%function_scope _%nat_scope _%list_scope _%nat_scope
subcode_start_in_code : forall (X : Type) (P : code X) (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
compiler_subcode : forall (j : nat) (x : X), (j, x :: nil) <sc P -> (linker j, c linker j x) <sc (i, compiler) /\ linker (1 + j) = lc x + linker j
existsb_nth : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (n : nat) (d : A), n < length l -> existsb f l = false -> f (nth n l d) = false

```coq
unfold linker; simpl.
rewrite <- Hc with (f := linker) (n := 1) (x := (i, lsum (snd P) + i)).
rewrite <- Hc with (f := linker) (n := 0) (x := (length (snd P) + fst P, lsum (snd P) + i)).
apply subcode_start_in_code with (X := X) (P := code_start P) (Q := (length (snd P) + fst P, lsum (snd P) + i)).
lia.
Qed.

original: unfold linker; simpl. rewrite <- Hc with (f := linker) (n := 1) (x := (i, lsum (snd P) + i)). rewrite <- Hc with (f := linker) (n := 0) (x := (length (snd P) + fst P, lsum (snd P) + i)). apply subcode_start_in_code with (X := X) (P := code_start P) (Q := (length (snd P) + fst P, lsum (snd P) + i)). lia.
